repnme.cdata!:
Korea - Environmental Research and
            Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project development
            objectives were successfully achieved. Highly satisfactory
            was the Bank's performance, who gained efficiency
            combining the preparation stage with that of two other
            projects on the subjects of environmental technology, and
            science/technical education, thus resulting in a clear
            understanding of sector-related policy issues. The overall
            borrower performance was satisfactory, with an impressive
            performance by project institutions, erasing an early
            "unsatisfactory" rating, related to a delayed
            legal covenant compliance. It is therefore interesting to
            note, as a lesson to be learned, that good working
            relationships, stemming from frequent and detailed
            supervision, combined with an efficient coordination by the
            Ministry of Education, can lead not only to a successful
            operation, but save a project, turning it around from an
            unsatisfactory assessment.

5079440.majtheme: Human development,Environment and natural resource management

repnme.cdata!:
Korea - Environmental Research and
            Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the project are to
            assist in upgrading the capacity of selected agricultural
            and veterinary colleges to undertake research into key
            environmental problems, reinforce the environmental aspects
            of basic science programs in the colleges in order to
            strengthen the training of environmental professionals and
            to establish appropriate arrangements for improving
            environment-related research and teaching programs.  The
            project will include specialized equipment to be financed by
            the Bank to support:  (a) the National Instrumentation
            Center for Environmental Management; (b) selected
            agricultural colleges; and (c) selected veterinary colleges.
            The government will finance complementary inputs related to
            making the equipment operational and maintaining it
            thereafter, namely, local transportation and installation
            costs, operation and maintenance and consumables.  The
            project will also include overseas training, experts and
            library materials.
